content: round bor work 7 rounds in single rib *k1 p1* on either side each of these is one completed around your ribbing should measure increase round approximately 1 / 2 5cm change to larger main needles complete the next round in the same colour as your ribbing so your increases blend seamlessly into the ribbing increase as follows *k13 13 14 14 14 14 15 15 16 then m1 using backwards loop increase* repeat round 8 stitches increased there are now 112 112 120 120 120 120 128 128 136 stitches on your needles break cc and introduce your mc knit all stitches placing markers as follows k20 20 21 21 21 22 24 24 26 pm k15 15 17 17 17 15 15 15 15 pm k41 41 43 43 43 45 49 49 53 pm k15 15 17 17 17 15 15 15 15 pm k to bor yoke increases short row optional row 1 increase round *k to 1 stitch before marker kfb sm kfb* repeat 3 more times k to short row are used to slightly raise the back of bor the sweater allowing it to sit better at the neckline and to help prevent the back of the row 2 knit all stitches no increases sweater riding up this step is entirely optional repeat these two row 16 19 20 23 25 28 29 but highly recommended 32 33 more times i use german short row but please feel free to use your favourite method you can find a video each increase round increases stitch count by 8 for german short row here stitches so there should now be 248 272 288 312 328 352 368 392 408 stitches on your needles at the end of your increases the colour block boxy tee - victoria lewis - tiny teal handcrafted - copyright 2021 4 short row optional continued **this is the perfect time to try on your sweater every body is different and trying on at this row 1 rs starting at bor knit to marker sm point is your first opportunity to really knit to marker sm k5 stitches turn mds customise the finished sweater to better fit your own wonderful body the given yoke depth row 2 ws purl back to bor slipping markers as measurements are a really good suggestion but you get to them slip bor purl to marker sm they are not set in stone i highly recommend purl to marker sm purl 5 stitches turn mds that you try on your sweater before going any further if you try on your sweater at this point row 3 rs knit back to bor sm knit to 10 and you are happy with the fit do a little dance stitches before previous wrap turn mds and move on to the next section if you decide that you would like some more length in the row 4 ws purl back to bor sm purl to 10 yoke please do keep knitting to
